title: Four Pillars of Chronic Disease
content: The four pillars of chronic disease account for over 80% of deaths in people over 50 who do not smoke. These include atherosclerotic disease (comprised of cardiovascular disease and cerebrovascular disease), cancer, neurodegenerative disease (Alzheimerâ€™s disease being the most common), and 'foundational disease' which is a spectrum of everything from hyperinsulinemia to insulin resistance to fatty liver disease to type 2 diabetes.

title: Three Components of Healthspan
content: The three components of healthspan include cognitive, physical/structural, and emotional health. Most efforts put into preserving cognition are directly in line with efforts to reduce the risk of dementia. The physical component, which includes issues like knee pain and back pain, is the first thing that starts to compromise quality of life and occurs decades before someone dies. Emotional health is least tethered to age.
